Jobs.title: Research Associate
Jobs.description: ', 'Research Associate in the Computer Laboratory within the Digital Technology Group.', '

Jobs.title: Postdoc Researcher - Improcess project
Jobs.description: ', 'Currently leading a research project, Improcess, under the supervision of Dr Alan Blackwell, involving collaborators in the Cambridge Computer Laboratory and Music Faculty, Microsoft Research Cambridge, and in the Anglia Ruskin Digital Performance Lab. This research aims to combine both tactile and highly abstract linguistic user interfaces with state-of-the-art real-time synthesis software in order to build new forms of musical device with a high capacity for improvisation.', '

Jobs.title: Lead Architect
Jobs.description: ', 'Architected and developed a wide variety of bespoke web applications and deployed them both into standard hosting environments and also large secure internal enterprise virtual machine clusters. The main suite of online tools were developed in order to increase the potential for collaborative innovation within large companies in areas such as idea management and community development and growth. Also designed, implemented and deployed client-readable domain specific languages for the critical parts of projects that required both absolute precision and a high tolerance for change.', '

Jobs.title: Ruby News Reporter
Jobs.description: ', 'Report upon changes and innovation within the Ruby community through writing news articles, and contributing to interviews.', '

Jobs.title: Technical Research Consultant for the DESTINO project
Jobs.description: ', 'Implemented and delivered the primary tool for DESTINO, an EPSRC-funded project aiming to deliver a decision support framework for local authorities considering the introduction of flexible transport services. Used agile development practices and the Ruby on Rails framework. Represented business logic with a client-readable domain specific language.', '

Jobs.title: Researcher and Developer
Jobs.description: ', 'Worked as a researcher, designer and developer. Built conceptual designs and working prototypes for a variety of projects. Initiated testing, version control and ticketing techniques for in-house development. Communicated directly with development teams, management and clients.', '

Jobs.title: Technical Research Consultant, EMIRES project
Jobs.description: ', 'Worked with a team of researchers and developers on EMIRES, a trans-European project that sought to combine the concepts of Demand Responsive Transport (DRT) with the provision of more sophisticated value added services based on the possibilities offered by more efficient information management. Combined a variety of SOAP-based web-services using a database-driven web application. The resulting product matched available jobs and transport routes for a given person and location.', '

Jobs.title: IT Consultant
Jobs.description: ', 'Ongoing management of basic IT facilities. Worked with designers to rebuild and re-brand their outward facing web-site.', '

summary: ', 'I am passionate about working in teams of smart, motivated people. I treat my work as a craft, and seek opportunities to learn, develop and share skills with others. I believe in the value of open source software, and aim to make significant contributions to such projects. ', '', 'I see programming primarily as a form of communication and as such am interested in domain specific languages, language oriented programming techniques and the aesthetics of programming languages. I also believe that the pursuit of conceptual efficiency is at least as important as computational efficiency.', '', 'I continue to enjoy presenting my thoughts, ideas and work at a number of events and institutions, including The University of Cambridge, QCon London, JAOO, RubyFoo, RubyFools in Copenhagen and Oslo, RailsConf Europe in Berlin and RubyEnRails in Amsterdam.', '
